alert.note: Alert for Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 5:27PM EDT until May 01 at 3:24AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of Spartanburg County, South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to drainages and streams, including parks, greenways and trails, golf courses, boat-access areas, farmland, and woodlands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 PM EDT, Lawsons Fork Creek in east Spartanburg from US 221 to Goldmine Rd remains out of its banks, flooding adjacent low-lying wooded and wetland areas, as well as portions of the Edwin Griffin Nature Preserve and The Country Club of Spartanburg. The USGS streamgauge located at Lake Forest Drive is reporting a stage of 13.86 feet for Lawsons Fork Creek. The stream crested at 14.40 feet at 8 am Friday morning and is now falling slowly. The rate of recession will gradually increase heading into the evening and overnight hours and Lawsons Fork Creek is expected to fall back below the Action/Advisory Stage of 12.0 feet early Saturday morning.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
